channel.title: How do I make this code use a public boolean of something not a boolean

item.title: How do I make this code use a public boolean of something not a boolean
item.dc:creator: @Nintendo_G Nintendo_G
item.description:
@Nintendo_G wrote:

Iâ€™m trying to add this code:

if (miHP <= 20) { if(playerissaradomin == true) { miHP = 99; teleportToX = 2427; teleportToY = 3077; heightLevel = 1; playerissaradomin = true; sendMessage("You died in castle wars"); } if (miHP <= 20) if(playeriszamorak == true) { miHP = 99; teleportToX = 2427; teleportToY = 3077; heightLevel = 1; playeriszamorak = true; sendMessage("You died in Castle wars"); } }
but it wants me to add a regular boolean for the playeriszamorak and the playerissaradomin but I already have a public boolean, how can I make it use the public boolean instead of making another boolean?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make this code use a public boolean of something not a boolean
